subject: Re: [junit] Junit and EJB
msgSnippet: Junit is a test frame work not classified to EJB/RMI, but to test an object. Hope when you said you had test an EJB or made a remote call you would have done
messageBody:
Junit is a test frame work not classified to EJB/RMI,
but to test an object. Hope when you said you had test
an EJB or made a remote call you would have done all
the initial setup - lookup and stuff like that. If you
have not done then you please make sure that you have
the rmi connection to your server is established and
your ejb lookup is clean and sucessful.

And may be its a good idea if you could check various
other Testing frameworks to test EJB's or server side
components, like HTTPUnit/Cactus(*).

This answer wouldn't be of much help, but could at
least helps you to check other testframe works
specific to j2ee.

cheers
-arun


--- sree devi <amulya_333@...> wrote: > Hi
friends,
> I have a doubt and I believe that you people can
> help me.
>
> My questions are:
> 1) Does junit support EJB?
>
> 2)Does junit support RMI?
>
> 3)I have a method that returns a javabean object.The
> method works
> fine else where but, when invoked in the test case
> it returns a
> null.What could be wrong?
>
> I request you to take a few seconds to answer
> these
> questions.
> Thanking you.
> Sincerely,
> Sreedevi Giridhar.
>
>
